title: What do you get when you cross... ?
content:
Q: What do you get when you cross Thesis roman with Sassoon italic?

A: Canada Type’s Informa Pro

Check it out here:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/informa-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100806234245/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/informa-pro/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/informa-pro/")

Am I right, or am I right?

Mikey :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content:
Exactly my thought...

[http://twitter.com/typographica/status/2305085765](http://web.archive.org/web/20100806234245/http:/twitter.com/typographica/status/2305085765 "http://twitter.com/typographica/status/2305085765")  
 [http://twitter.com/typographica/status/2305210506](http://web.archive.org/web/20100806234245/http:/twitter.com/typographica/status/2305210506 "http://twitter.com/typographica/status/2305210506")  
 [http://twitter.com/typographica/status/2305394716](http://web.archive.org/web/20100806234245/http:/twitter.com/typographica/status/2305394716 "http://twitter.com/typographica/status/2305394716")

I contacted MyFonts and the designer and there's a long backstory to this, involving a '70s typeface that was new to me called Signa. Patrick claims Sassoon and TheSans had no influence on his work, which I find remarkable. Was going to write a Typographica piece if I get some time.

I knew there was some font scandal!

_“TheSans had no influence on his work, which I find remarkable”_

Remarkable? I would say unbelievable. I think its really obvious that the designer merged the two designs—and the result?— it looks unabashedly like two merged designs— nothing else. Normally I don’t have too much of a problem with that (well, if its ugly that’s another story) unless the designer cites his inspiration(s). As Lisa Lampanelli would say, “Your fronting and I don’t appreciate”.

Xavier Dupre comes to mind. He wanted to try Officina and Unit he did so—Vista and Sanuk. He wanted give a go with Triplex— Megano. At least he said so. I respect that because he respected his audience/customers by telling us.

Post when you complete that article on typographica and thank you for the links too

Mikey :-)
You are generous to Informa putting it in the same camp with Xavier Dupré’s work.

<cite>"Patrick claims Sassoon and TheSans had no influence on his work"</cite>  
Oh man. Shall we call that "borderline believable"?

On a side note, I always find it funny when font specimens boldly show off the letter combinations that _don't_ work. What's up with that "nsi" sequence in "sensibilities" in the [first Informa image](http://web.archive.org/web/20100806234245/http:/origin.myfonts.com/s/aw/720x360/53/0/27379.png)?
